lines.text: Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?

[she grabs Chucky]
Talk to me.
[pause]
Come on, talk!
[pause]
I said, "talk to me", damn it!
[Chucky gives no answer]
All right! I'll make you talk!
[Karen grabs Chucky, lights up her fireplace and holds Chucky near the fire]
I SAID TALK TO ME, DAMN IT, OR ELSE I'M GONNA THROW YOU IN THE FIRE!
[Chucky comes alive]

[screams]
YOU STUPID BITCH, YOU FILTHY SLUT! I'LL TEACH YOU TO FUCK WITH ME!
[Chucky attacks Karen]
Ugly doll!

[as the elevator rises up]
Fuck you...

[as Andy places Chucky in the fireplace and gets ready to light it up]
No, Andy, NO!
[pause]
We're friends 'til the end! Remember?
This is the end, friend!
[Andy lights the fireplace and Chucky starts to scream as he burns]
Hi, I'm Chucky, and I'm your friend till the end. Hidey-ho!

[Karen opens Chucky's battery slot and finds that there are no batteries in the doll]
HI, I'M CHUCKY! WANNA PLAY?
[Karen screams and drops the Chucky doll on the floor]
His real name is Charles Lee Ray and he's been sent down from Heaven by daddy to play with me.

[Chucky has just attempted to strangle Jack]
Believe me now?
Yeah... but who's gonna believe ME?
Hi Mikey!

[after being shot]
Oh God, I'm dying!
[repeated line]
GIVE ME THE BOY!

[Stumbling and breathing heavily after being shot]
I- I gotta find something here!
Chucky says Aunt Maggie was a bitch and got what she deserved.
Andy! How can you say something so horrible?
I didn't say it! Chucky did!

The only person that I let in on the fact that I was still alive was a six-year-old kid. I'm gonna be six years old again. Well, John, it's been fun, but I gotta go. I have a date with six-year-old boy... and you have a date with death.
Andy, who're you talking to?
Chucky.
Chucky, huh?
Yeah. He's sitting right over there.
Chucky's been talking to you too hasn't he?
Yes.
What's he been saying?
All kinds of things. His real name is Charles Lee Ray. And he's been sent down, from Heaven, by Daddy to play with me.
Anything else?
Yes. He said Aunt Maggie was a real bitch, and got what she deserved.
Andy, how could you say something so horrible?
I didn't say it Chucky did.
Andy, you're making this up.
But I'm not. Chucky's alive. Really, he is.
Andy! Chucky... Chucky's a doll. He's made out of plastic and stuffing. Now look at him - look at him. Now does he *look* like anything else to you?
Don't! You'll hurt him!
Andy! LOOK! Now, you really don't think Chucky is alive, do you?
But he is.
Andy, *STOP IT!* Please!
It's 'cause of Aunt Maggie, you're yelling at me, isn't it?
Yes, I guess it is.
I'm sorry. I'll stop telling stories.
Okay. You wanna sleep in with me tonight?
No, it's alright. I've got Chucky.
[Karen leaves. Andy turns to Chucky]
You're right, Chucky. She didn't believe me.

[as he attacks Mike Norris while he's driving]
Good night, asshole!
You hear this, you son of a bitch! I'm gonna get you for this! I'm gonna get you and I'm gonna get Eddy, no matter what!

[screaming]
Give me the boy, and I'll let you live!
Look, you stay here; I have to go tinkle.
Oh shit,
[silently, after he watches Charles lee Ray get shot by Detective Norris; Jack Santos pulls up in a marked squad car]
OH SHIT!

Hello John. Over here. Hi. It's me Chucky. What do ya think? The gri gri work? You know, when I came here learning that stuff about how to cheat death, I thought maybe you were pulling my chain. But, not now. Uh, uh. Not now. Only one problem.
What?
This. I didn't think anybody could hurt me. But, last night I got shot. And you know something? It hurt. It hurt like a son of a bitch, it even bled! Why is that, John?
You're turning human.

[in shock]
What?
The more time you spend in that body, the more human you become.
You mean I have to live out the rest of my life in this body? No fuckin' way!
[points his finger]
You got me into this, you get me out!
I can't do that, Chucky.
Why not?
Because you're an abomination. An outrage against nature! You've perverted everything I've taught you and used it for evil! And you have to be stopped!

[after Karen Barclay's gun jams after aiming at Chucky]
What's wrong, gun jammed?
[Chucky screams viciously and charges at Karen]
Look George. Some child left their doll on the elevator.
Leave it alone. Let whoever is looking for it find it, and it will be there.
The heart, the heart! Shoot it in the heart!
Okay, mister. What do you have to say about this?
About what?
You know what I'm talking about. Turning the TV on, and putting Chucky in front of it, when I told you it was time to go to bed.
I didn't do that.
Oh no? Then what did Chucky do? Walk into the living room and turn it on, all by himself?
Did you do that Chucky?
Andy! Stop it! Now, get under the covers. Hurry!
But, Aunt Maggie...
Under the covers and not another word!
But, I didn't put Chucky in front of the TV.
Okay. Enough, alright? Now goodnight.
Goodnight, Aunt Maggie.
[Maggie leaves. Andy turns to Chucky]
I told you she'd be mad if you watched the news.
[first lines]
I got the strangler! Wabash and Van Buren.
Karen!
Hi.
You know that doll that you wanted for Andy. Only costs a hundred bucks?
Yeah. The Good Guy doll.
There's a peddler in the alley. Behind the store. And I think he's got one.
What? What would a peddler be doing with a doll?
Who cares! Would you grab your purse and come on? We can get a deal on it.
But, I can't just leave my counter.
Do you want the damn doll or don't ya?
Of course I do.
Well, then come on.
[grabs Karen's hand]
Come on!
Alright!
Well John it's been fun but I got to go. I have a date with a 6 year old boy and you have a date with death!
[Stabs John's voodoo doll]
So long John!
Miss Barclay!
Detective Norris!
You no been to school to pick up your son yet?
No I came directly from work why?
Let's go to my office!
Is there something wrong with Andy?
Please!
[Referring that Andy is in the station]
I don't know how to tell you this Miss Barclay.
Tell me what?
Give it up, Ray. It's over.

[opens garage door]
There he is.
[Maggie & Karen walk over to Peddler]
Okay. Show her.
[Peddler presents Good Guy doll]

[to Karen]
Well, is it a Good Guy or not?
It is. It is!
Yeah, well, I told you.
Oh, uh, how much do you want for it?
Fifty bucks.
Ten and not a penny more.
Thirty.
W-What? Are you kidding? That thing is not worth thirty dollars.
Hey, look, take it or leave it. Somebody else can buy it.
I'll take it!
Karen! It's too much money.
No, it isn't. You have no idea how much Andy wants this doll.
But, we don't even know if the damn thing works.

[hands Karen Good Guy doll box]
There you go, lady. May it bring you and your kid a lot of joy, huh.
Thank you.
Hey, hold on, you! H-How do we know if the damn thing isn't stolen, huh?
Ah, steal this!
[gives inappropriate gesture to Maggie]
Ah, steal this, yourself.
Maggie.
[grabs Maggie's hand]
I think I dated him.

[laughs]
Come on, we gotta get back to work.

[Karen and Maggie return to their shift]
Miss Barclay so nice of you to drop by, had a nice break?
Sorry Mr. Criswell I was only gone for a moment.
Don't be hard on her Mr. Criswell we were just downstairs getting her son a birthday present.
We have specified break times for activities like that Miss Peterson.
[to Karen]
Mrs Howell has taken sick and we're short handed tonight. You have to fill in for her.

[Taken aback]
I can't! I have to pick up my son from daycare in an hour!
I' m sorry but this is an emergency.
Wait a second. I will take over for her.
Miss Peterson you work in shoes, not in jewellery. You'll simply have to do it. Now you can take off at 5 but you have to be back by 7.
It's my son's birthday.
Miss Barclay are you happy with your job here?

[Defeated]
Yes of course I am.
Then I suggest that...

[Interrupting]
Chill out will you Walter? I will take of Andy for you.
Oh Maggie you can't.
Don't be silly. It will be the hottest date I had in months.

[Sarcastically]
He wants you for a best friend! Yeah sure!
Hey mister! I'm not going to hurt you. Do you remember me?
No I don't.
I bought a doll from you.
Doll?
Yes a Good-Guy doll with my friend at the back of the department store a few days ago. Do you remember?
Oh yeah doll. What about it?
Where did you get it?
What would you give if I told you?
I don't have much!
[Takes money out of her purse]
You're welcome to whatever I have!

[Snatches the money and throws it away]
Not enough! What else you got?
That's all I got!
All you got? Is that all you got?
[Looks at Karen's legs]
You have a lot!

[Petrified]
No!
[the peddler undoes his fly and forces himself onto her]
No stop!
